attributes.comment:
I have several dozen friends who have gone through the immigration process and
applied for either Green Cards or Citizenship. I have no problems with the rate
increases for the immigration procedure. Fees for every service are going up and
the agency must get the money to be able to handle their workload and update
their capabilities and, most importantly, have the manpower to be able to review
the applications for possible National Security violations. I also know the
hardships that can be caused by the length of the review process, and anything
that speeds this up is a welcome relief. However, I do not agree with the
comment made by several people that this department should get funding from
Congress. I believe that if someone follows the rules and process for becoming a
citizen they should be allowed, but I do not agree that my tax dollars should pay
for that process. I would be greatly saddened to see any sort of funding from
Congress funneled to this issue!
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Michelle Kerr
